title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. The steps to reproduce are as follows: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. The new data source has no database/table/column information. The actual result is that there are no children listed when changing the data source for a data set on the data set editor page of the query tab. Additionally, closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
EB: The expected result is that when changing the data source, the children of the new data source should be listed.
SR: 1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement. 2. Select a data source that has no database/table/column information. 3. Observe that there are no children listed when changing the data source for the data set on the data set editor page of the query tab. 4. Close the data set editor and reopen it to confirm that the issue persists.
